results.title: Running high: a story of pain and joy ...
results.creator_credit: Gus Howard and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Novices and champions prepare for, and run the 1983 Festival City Marathon. Robert de Castella intersperses candid interviews with his marathon running philosophy and techniques. Discusses the exhilaration of personal improvement, the disappointment of hitting the wall and the reasons behind the increasing popularity of running throughout the world.

results.title: Nicholas Nickleby
results.creator_credit: Alberto Cavalcanti, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
Features the British film production house Ealing Studios adaptation of the classic tale by Charles Dickens. Stars Derek Bond as Nicholas Nickleby, Sybil Thorndike as Mrs. Squeers, Sir Cedric Hardwicke as the steely hearted uncle and Stanley Holloway as the earthy thespian Vincent Crummels.

results.title: The Transition tapes
results.brief_description: These tapes are intended to aid the Transition Education evaluation process by raising relevant questions and issues. They enable re-assessment of attitudes to learning and resources, employment and unemployment from five viewpoints : student, teacher, community, employer and school administrator. No other credits available.

results.title: Equal opportunity tapes
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of equal opportunity to both male and female teachers. Tape 1. Introduces and defines the concept of equal opportunity. 2. Designed to show what the real world is about for women. 3. Attempts to encourage teachers to examine, analyse and consider altering their classroom practice.

results.title: Butt welds in sheet metal
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Gas Welding”.
Episode five in a series of nine short instructional films showing methods for oxyacetylene welding. This film demonstrates how welding on a sheet of metal and then welding with a rod are necessary steps before proceeding to butt weld two pieces of metal together.

results.title: Burma victory
results.creator_credit: Roy Boulting, David Macdonald and Army Film Unit
results.brief_description: Compilation of footage covering the Burma campaign against the Japanese between 1942 and 1945. For censorship reasons this campaign was given very little newsreel coverage and the footage was assembled into an absorbing narrative. Footage taken by British, Indian and American Combat Cameramen of South-East Asia Command.

results.title: Bullfight
results.brief_description: Anna Sokolow recreates and reacts to a remembered bullfight and through her dancing recaptures her feelings while watching the fight. The climax is reached when the dancer identifies with the bullfighter, the bull and the death in the ring.
results.description: Anna Sokolow recreates and reacts to a remembered bullfight and through her dancing recaptures her feelings while watching the fight. The climax is reached when the dancer identifies with the bullfighter, the bull and the death in the ring.

results.title: The Bulk Link
results.creator_credit: Scope Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The ‘bulk-link’ is the vital bridge from the harvest field to the shipping port- the bulk grain handlers. New techniques in the field, the central storage facilities at the embarkation port have made the bulk link a more economical and efficient process. Photography: Edwin Scragg.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Scope Films and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Brief encounter [study extract]
results.brief_description: An extract from “Brief encounter” directed by David Lean. An ordinary suburban housewife, and a young married doctor, meet casually, fall deeply in love, but realises family ties do not permit their passion so they part. In the extract Laura and Alec spend their last day together before he goes to South Africa. They part where they met - in the station buffet. Their last moments are shattered by the arrival of a talkative friend of Laura’s. In despair she almost commits suicide but reason prevails and she returns to her husband. The extract is dominated by the heavy atmosphere of the railway station, the emotional dialogue and the climax of the suicide attempt.

results.title: Breaking the habit
results.creator_credit: Henry Jacobs, John Korty, American Cancer Society and Korty Films
results.brief_description: With the theme: “the self-delusion of the cigarette smoker”, records a conversation between two cartoon characters, George, the “quitting” smoker, and his friend. Concludes on a serious but hopeful note, pointing out that the chances of developing serious diseases decrease the moment you stop smoking.
